intro: Elaphrium heterophyllum, commonly known as the narrowleaf elaphrium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
